questions.question: As per the collision theory, what are the factors that determine an effective collision?

choices.answer: Rate of collision and enough energy

questions.question: If the temperature is higher, what happens to rate of collision?

choices.answer: The rate of collision becomes higher
The rate of collision becomes lower
The rate of collision remains the same

questions.question: What happens to the rate of collision if the surface area is lower?

choices.answer: The rate of collision remains unaffected.
The rate of collision becomes lower.
The rate of collision becomes lower.

questions.question: Which of the following is/are factor/s that affect/s rate of collision?
Which of the following statement is the principle behind use of pressure cookers?

choices.answer: High temp results to low reaction rate, thus faster cooking
Low temp results to high reaction rate, thus faster cooking
High temp results to high reaction rate, thus faster cooking
Low temp results to low reaction rate, thus faster cooking

questions.question: How can you describe the rate of reaction for chemical weathering of rocks?
What is the effect of a lower concentration to rate of collision?
Why are food stored in a freezer if you want to keep it longer?
Which of the following statements is false?

choices.answer: If a solid is split into pieces, the surface area increases
Reactions involving solid can only take place at the surface
The larger the pieces, the larger the surface area
More collisions equals to a faster rate of reaction

questions.question: Is it possible that a collision occurs however there is no reaction?
